ygData.msgSnippet: In front of him was the resting place of the Cybertronian Fire, it rose above the landscape like a metal mountain. Phobia knew the size from his scanns, but

In front of him was the resting place of the Cybertronian Fire, it 
rose above the landscape like a metal mountain. Phobia knew the size 
from his scanns, but somehow being this close made it seem larger. A 
monument to cybertronian technology, a design made like a fine 
crystal, sleek and smooth, and very much unlike it's predicon 
counterparts. The pred ships were bulkier with so much weaponry that 
they appeared as space porcupines from a distance.

"Magnifficent" Phobia said, all eight eyes watching the features the 
ship had to offer.

"This is truly a remarkable piece of machinery." The predicon was in 
such awe he nearly forgot where he was. his only thought was "Welcome 
to my parlor said the fly to the spider."

 In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Kluster::
> 
> Kluster nods at Phobia's comment. "True."
> 
> He looks over at Hysteria, grinning. "You wern't notified because 
you 
> obvioustly decided to take a long nap at the time. Savanah is 
right, though, 
> the engines were less important that the whole crew."
> 
> He looks forward, seeing The Cybertronian Fire in front of them.
> 
> "Welcome to my ship," he says to the bots behind him, speeding up 
toward the 
> entrance.
